About This Game

Play as two of gaming's most disturbing and realistic criminals; Lynch – a self medicated psychopath - and Kane - a disillusioned and desperate ex-mercenary, in a gritty and brutal crime shooter from IO Interactive. Kane and Lynch face the consequences of their actions when a simple job gone wrong finds them on a desperate and frantic struggle to escape. Experience their fight to survive through the back streets and rooftops of Shanghai’s gritty underworld. They can trust no one, not even each other as the cracks begin to appear in Lynch’s sanity and Kane’s stability.
Non-stop action in Single Player, online Co-op and Multiplayer. New and unique Fragile Alliance multiplayer game modes provide an experience to suit all criminal minds.
  • Raw, Real & Uncut - Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days introduces a unique, unseen visual style to video games. Taking visual references from documentary filmmaking and the user-generated era, Kane & Lynch 2 delivers a sense of intense realism never before experienced.
  • Play as Lynch - Play as Lynch and follow his story. He is living a comfortable life in Shanghai, he’s making money and is about to make a fat deal where the pay is beyond his wildest dreams and nothing is going to get in his way.
  • Down Not Dead - Adding further intensity to the brutal gameplay, players will have a second chance at taking out their enemies; Choose between continuing the gunfight from the ground or try to escape by crawling towards cover.
  • Online Co-op - Play as Kane and Lynch
  • Fragile Alliance - The highly celebrated multiplayer experience returns with a collection of new and improved modes.
  • From the Creators of the Critically Acclaimed Hitman Series - The studio behind the best-selling Hitman titles and 2007’s Kane & Lynch: Dead Men.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    • OS: Windows XP/Vista/7
    • Processor: Intel 3.0 GHz or AMD 2.5 GHz or higher
    • Memory: 1 GB (XP), 2 GB (Vista)
    • Graphics: Nvidia 7800 / ATI X1800 or better (Shader Model 3.0, 512 MB Video Memory)
    • DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Sound: DirectX 9.0c Compatible Sound Card
    • Controller Support: Xbox 360 Controller

Kaneki Ken
80 products in account
65 reviews
Recommended
45.5 hrs on record
Posted: May 10
The story of Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days unfolds through forty-eight hours of hell, with a script that would look deep into a film of high quality. The two characters find themselves in very difficult situations and once again have to rely on each other to survive, which is far from obvious when you were at his heels is a huge criminal organization that the law enforcement agencies in Shanghai. It is the usual "two against all", therefore, strengthened by a series of elements really hit the spot (the camera movement, the enemy AI), which perhaps is not surprising for the variety of situations but that bases its success on a gameplay solid and engaging. In this sense, the multiplayer mode serve as effective boundary while not stealing the show at the story mode, and complete the picture of an experience perhaps not very durable but certainly intense.

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
17 of 23 people (74%) found this review helpful
1 person found this review funny
TheEngiGuy
367 products in account
26 reviews
Recommended
18.9 hrs on record
Posted: June 8
TL;DR: generic gameplay, very short and repetitive story mode, but stunning art direction, immersive audio, multiplayer and two great characters.

Kane & Lynch 2 is one of those games that I consider "victims of the bandwagon". It is about two violent, sociopathic anti-heroes reuniting each other after the disastrous events of the first game, trying to make a deal and be set for life, but always end up making a bad situation even worse.
The intro of the game presents you with protagonists' darkest trip: both are naked and a mysterious man are cutting their skins to pieces, shown through documentary-style camera work.

The neat thing about this game is the connection between sound effects and ambient music that blends nicely with Lynch's psychotic mind based on the situations in game.
Sure the game doesn't go well when compared to the first game, especially regarding the repetitive setting (streets and back alleys of Shangai at night time for the most part, unlike the first one with varying bank heists, nightclub shooting, skyscrapers, jungles...), and the storyline lasts for 5 hours, but gameplay and graphic wise it does better. I don't get this much negativity regarding gameplay, because it's mostly a generic third-person-shooter and I found the controls to be responsive enough and guns not 100% accurate (even though some shotguns are awkwardly more accurate than rifles at long range).

The overall storyline is ok, weaker than the story from the first game, but some scenes can be quite memorable. Sadly, the story starts to lose its charm halfway through... There are also complaints regarding lack of an ending: while that is true and I myself wanted to see a final cutscene instead of a "partial cliffhanger", the way I see it the storyline ends in the penultimate level, while the last level is simply "escape from everything".

Graphics are generally good - with a lot of effects that simulate a videocamera - but needed some tweaks.
Another complaint from the people in general is the shaking camera when sprinting, but YOU CAN TURN IT OFF in the options. I personally have no problems with that since it adds with the men's bad moments.

Then there's the multiplayer, which is admittedly the best part of this game. An original and well executed multiplayer centered around heists, but it's dead (people don't like change, no wonder why). You can still find Steam groups that organize regular multiplayer matches, like this one ! It does suffer from netcode instability sometimes, though.

Despite its flaws, flat storyline and the launch price being the same of an AAA title which helped decrease the game's reputation (along with the usual Youtube videos where they only show the negative sides so that people go "omg then the game sux"), it's still a solid game for the first playthrough. It can be compared to Spec Ops: The Line only because both have generic gameplay, but awesome experiences, with the only difference being that Kane & Lynch 2 tries its best to be ugly and make you uncomfortable in a violent, deal-gone-wrong scenario.
In conclusion, the overall art style doesn't appeal to everyone. If you like dark and disturbing games, go for it. If you liked the first game, don't expect this one to be the same, some features that made the first game special are sadly missing.

Personal rating: 6.6/10

sloth speedskater
3,376 products in account
39 reviews
Recommended
3.0 hrs on record
Posted: May 19
Despite its infamy, it's mostly more of the same generic 3rd person cover shooter, but this time you're in control of Lynch, the crazier of the two bad guys. I felt that there were no levels as good as the great ones in K&L 1, but also none that were as bad as the worst ones.

It's a really, really short game, so I wanted to know the launch price and after some Googling and Archive.org-ing I found that it was $49.99 O_O and I think that really helped this game's bad reputation as this really felt like it should've launched in the same price range as CoJ: Gunslinger of FC: Blood Dragon. Not that it's as good as Gunslinger, no. It's not even close. But it's not that catastrophic.

I think it's worth it to play this once if you like unlikable (uhh, is that possible? you know what I mean) protagonists and want to see them screw up and get themselves into another bad situation.

One thing I didn't like is the stylistic choice of having headshots 'censored' by the pixel thingie. I guess it was supposed to show you the violence through the eyes of an unrepentant psychopath, but it got old really quick.


rating - 3 silver sloths
